name: Anirudha Majumdar
content: Majumdar | IRoM-Lab Anirudha Majumdar Associate Professor, Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering Co-Director, Princeton Robotics Initiative Associated Faculty, Computer Science Princeton University Visiting Research Scientist, Google DeepMind @ Princeton Email: ani.majumdar at princeton . edu Office: EQuad D202-B Lab webpage.      Twitter.      YouTube. Research Interests I am interested in developing generalist robots that are safe, trustworthy, and capable. Recently, my group has been developing techniques to improve generalist capabilities, ensure safety and alignment with human values and preferences, and evaluate large-scale robot policies via simulation and hardware-based testing and red teaming. Please see our lab webpage for more information. Bio Anirudha Majumdar is an Associate Professor at Princeton University in the Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering (MAE) department, and co-Director of the Princeton Robotics Initiative. He also holds a part-time visiting research scientist position at Google DeepMind in Princeton. Majumdar received a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 2016, and a B.S.E. in Mechanical Engineering and Mathematics from the University of Pennsylvania in 2011. Subsequently, he was a postdoctoral scholar at Stanford University from 2016 to 2017 at the Autonomous Systems Lab in the Aeronautics and Astronautics department. He is a recipient of the Sloan Fellowship, ONR Young Investigator Program (YIP) award, NSF CAREER award, Google Faculty Research Award (twice), Amazon Research Award (twice), Young Faculty Researcher Award from the Toyota Research Institute, Best Student Paper Award (as advisor) at the Conference on Robot Learning (CoRL), Paper of the Year Award from the International Journal of Robotics Research (IJRR), Best Conference Paper Award at the International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA), Alfred Rheinstein Faculty Award (Princeton), and the Excellence in Teaching Award (Princeton SEAS).
